observation.output:
Original pattern: ^src/gen/.*$
Windows pattern: ^src\\gen\\.*$
POSIX pattern: ^src/gen/.*$
Combined pattern: ^src\\gen\\.*$|^src/gen/.*$
Compiled pattern: ^src\\gen\\.*$|^src/gen/.*$

=== Testing path matching ===
  src/gen/bad.py       -> MATCH
  src\gen\bad.py       -> MATCH
  src\gen/bad.py       -> NO MATCH
  src/gen\bad.py       -> NO MATCH
  ./src/gen/bad.py     -> NO MATCH
  .\src\gen\bad.py     -> NO MATCH

=== The problem ===
When os.path.join('src\\gen', 'bad.py') is called on Unix:
  Result: src\gen/bad.py
  Matches pattern: NO

=== Potential solution ===
We need to normalize paths before matching, or create more comprehensive patterns
  Normalized path: src/gen/bad.py
  Normalized matches: YES
